ygData.subject: This is wrong, I know it!

Subject: This is wrong, I know it!

X-OriginalArrivalTime: 24 Oct 2000 12:40:37.0430 (UTC) FILETIME=[9C242D60:01C03DB7]
From: "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@...>



* The sound of his pain was welcomed, but only to the more evil and cunning 
side of her systems which controlled her beast modes. The other side was 
completely applaud that she could have ever had such modes in the first 
place, even considering aborting them once or if she ever managed to gain 
control of her functions again.
But even the thought of abortion brought on a more will for the modes to 
live and act, which only urged them on to swamp out her systems more and 
more each moment. However, they would never be able to get total control.

The creature was urged on to continue its acts as it hears Prowls arm snap, 
the painful expression on his face rather satisfying. The mech-fluid only 
clarifying  itï¿½s sinful deeds.
However, while the modes were distracted by their pleasure of Prowls pain, 
the more logical and robotic side of her systems were slowly and surely 
inching for control.
It saw Prowl through the eyes of this mode, through the keen sight, which 
was sure enough to miss nothing. And what it saw made its spark almost 
shatter in fear.
Iron Raptors beast modes were tarring up the only bot she had ever loved, 
and with no reason at all.
However, little did she know that it was only the blood lust, which she had 
been keeping contained. which was being shown.
Not enough time in the battlefield to ease the strain of two deadly and 
horrific beast modes. And now, released and unable to be contained, they 
were expelling their rages that would have been used in war.

She flexed her claws, only managing to sink them deeper into Prowls armor. 
Her weight baring down against him, wanting to push him to the floor and 
have him off his feet. A vulnerable position for any stalked prey.
But then she heard it, something that brought a rather surprising reaction 
from her.
Love? Did she know that word, did she know that name? Yes, yes she did. But 
where, how?
The beast modes were confused, but the logic knew better.
In one fleeting moment, as she looked into Prowls face, she knew just who he 
was and why he was here. She remembered.
And in that same moment, the logic took more control over the massive form.
With a heave of her body she moved from Prowl, still in a little confusion 
but not as much as before.
But he was right, just WHAT was she doing? Attacking the only thing in this 
entire stinking world that she loved even more then her own self.

She stepped back and looked at him, mech-fluid ridden and in pain.
SHE was the one who had caused this, had caused the pain which twisted his 
features at that very moment.
And at that moment, she was disgusted with herself.

Her beast modes fought back to regain control, wanting to at least taste his 
fluid against its tongue once again. But there was no way past the logic 
now, the logic which could not completely master control but enough to know 
what it was doing was wrong. Way wrong.

So, she simply stood there now, her mouth dripping mech-fluid and acidic 
saliva, simply staring at Prowl with an expression which communicated her 
problem. Her body stiff and alert, but questioning of its own reactions 
now.*
